summary:
Methodism is a Protestant religion started by John Wesley in the 1700s. It began within the Anglican Church but became its own denomination after Wesley's death. Methodists believe in the power of faith to change a person's character and emphasize the importance of good works. They are known for their missionary work and have around 80 million followers worldwide.

Methodist worship includes traditional church services and special events like camp meetings. They place a strong emphasis on helping others through charity and social action. Early Methodists welcomed people from all social classes, especially those who were often excluded from church, like laborers and slaves.
title: Methodism
